[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [State Management] [Pubkey Mapping] Can InitialPubkeyMap be manipulated to redirect operations between different pubkey variants, bypassing security checks throughout the contract? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [State Management] [Candidate List Integrity] Can State.Candidates.Value.Value list become corrupted if add/remove operations at lines 174 and 298 don't maintain proper ordering or uniqueness? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Access Control] [Parliament Override] Does parliament's ability to bypass admin checks at line 27 create a centralization risk where governance can seize any candidate? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: SetCandidateAdmin()] [Admin Transfer Attack] Can an attacker exploit the admin transfer to set input.Admin to a contract address they control, then use that contract to perform unauthorized operations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: SetCandidateAdmin()] [Orphan Management] If a candidate quits election after admin is set, does the admin entry persist in State.CandidateAdmins allowing phantom admin control? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: AnnounceElection(Address)] [Signature Replay] Can Context.RecoverPublicKey at line 95 be exploited with replayed signatures from previous transactions to register candidates without consent? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: AnnounceElection(Address)] [Admin Self-Assignment] Can a candidate set themselves as their own admin at line 103, and does this create any authorization vulnerabilities when quitting? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: AnnounceElectionFor()] [Forced Registration] Can an attacker force-register all potential candidate pubkeys to prevent legitimate candidates from announcing, performing a preemptive DoS attack? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: AnnounceElectionFor()] [Sponsor Mismatch] If the sponsor at line 140 differs from the actual candidate owner, can this create disputes over locked token ownership on quit? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: AnnounceElection(byte[])] [Historical Data Exploitation] Can attackers leverage preserved historical data (terms, missed slots) from line 160 when re-announcing to manipulate consensus or profit calculations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: LockCandidateNativeToken()] [Lock ID Uniqueness] Does using Context.OriginTransactionId as lockId at line 184 guarantee uniqueness across all transactions, or can batch transactions cause collisions? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: LockCandidateNativeToken()] [Virtual Address Security] Are virtual addresses generated at line 185 deterministic and collision-resistant, or can attackers predict and frontrun lock addresses? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: QuitElection(StringValue)] [Token Recovery Failure] If both CandidateSponsorMap is null and the candidate's private key is lost, are locked tokens permanently stuck in virtual address? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: QuitElection(StringValue)] [Admin Revocation Attack] Can a malicious admin quit election immediately after announcement to grief the candidate and potentially steal locked tokens? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: QuitElection(StringValue)] [Voting State Desync] If RemoveOption at line 257 succeeds but subsequent state updates fail, can this desync election state with vote contract state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: QuitElection(byte[])] [Consensus Disruption] Can the current miner check at lines 293-296 be bypassed during consensus transitions when miner list is being updated? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [State: ManagedCandidatePubkeysMap] [Storage Bloat] Can repeated admin changes and candidate registrations cause unbounded growth of ManagedCandidatePubkeysMap entries at lines 46-54? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [State: DataCentersRankingList] [Ranking Manipulation] Can setting DataCenters[pubkey] = 0 at line 265 be exploited to manipulate data center rankings and profit distribution unfairly? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [State: CandidateInformationMap] [Information Tampering] Can preserved CandidateInformation from previous candidacy at line 161 be exploited to bypass new candidate validation rules? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: GetParliamentDefaultAddress()] [Contract Address Cache] Can State.ParliamentContract.Value caching at line 68-70 become stale if parliament contract is upgraded, breaking authorization? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [Function: GetParliamentDefaultAddress()] [External Call Trust] Does the contract trust ParliamentContract.GetDefaultOrganizationAddress at line 72 without validation, allowing parliament to manipulate admin overrides? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [General] [Initial Miner Privilege] Can initial miners exploit their special status in IsCurrentCandidateOrInitialMiner at line 79-80 to gain unauthorized admin control? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [General] [Banned Pubkey Evasion] Can banned candidates re-register using pubkey variants or case differences not covered by BannedPubkeyMap at line 63? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [General] [Token Symbol Trust] Does the contract properly validate Context.Variables.NativeSymbol at lines 191 and 246, or can symbol manipulation cause wrong token transfers? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Candidate.cs] [General] [Memo Field Exploit] Are memo fields at lines 193 and 248 properly sanitized, or can they be exploited for log injection or storage bloat attacks? (Low)
